If one desires to become a nun, she shall first abide in the convent, for three years, learning the boundaries of monasticism. She shall be taught from the book of the Paradise of the Holy Fathers, the Cross-Bearers, and instructed in the true philosophy of monasticism. Once she has matured and gained the recommendation of all the nuns, in the presence of the Abbot and the entire monastic community she shall be called before the sanctuary after the recitation of the psalms during Vespers. She shall then prostrate before the sanctuary, the relics of the saints, the Abbot, and the entire monastic community.
